intro: Sanicula orthacantha var. orthacantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sanicle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a distinctive narrow, elongated shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early summer, followed by dark blue to black berries that are a food source for various bird species.
